sentence.Network_en: Butterbur and coltsfoot belong to two different genera of Compositae.
sentence.Network_cn: 蜂斗菜与款冬则是菊科不同属的两种植物.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: translating medieval Latin pes pulli 'foal's foot', with reference to the shape of the leaves

means.word_mean: 1. tufted evergreen perennial herb having spikes of tiny white flowers and glossy green round to heart-shaped leaves that become coppery to maroon or purplish in fall

2. perennial herb with large rounded leaves resembling a colt's foot and yellow flowers appearing before the leaves do; native to Europe but now nearly cosmopolitan; used medicinally especially formerly
